title: Marquee sign
content:
I would love to have a typeface similar to the squared off condensed typeface like this one. Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_5689-1_5772.jpg)
author: meghan

comments.content: I'd probably have a look to [Jeff Levine](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Jeff_Levine) collection. Some might do the job quite well: [Canby](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/canby), [Slim James](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/slim-james), [Lobby Card](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/lobby-card), [Deerfield](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/deerfield)...

It looks very close to **[Matthan Sans NC](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-2&ffam=Matthan%20Sans%20NC%20-%20Regular&fid=0020df2a3e74507f8d95975e1359b049&fsize=60&text=EBAY%20SPECIAL%20176%20COUNT%20SIGN%20LETTERS&wrap=2)** free font by  
Jayvee D. Enaguas [NipCen, 2009]
Thanks Ryuk, Was definitely looking at Canby. I do love the softness of the type in the image. The subtle round letters.

The letters are in an old style called stovepipe. FAIK They are not a font as such. I can offer several fonts that generally match the letterforms shown in the image --\_A\_ with apex top, \_R\_ with vertical leg, \_S\_ with horizontal center stroke.  
Valuco [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/aesthetic-apparatus/valuco/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aesthetic-apparatus/valuco/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/aesthetic-apparatus/valuco/")  
Gaz [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/gaz/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/gaz/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/gaz/")  
Liquor Store [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/liquorstore/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/liquorstore/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/liquorstore/")  
Iwan Reschniev [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fdi/iwan-reschniev/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fdi/iwan-reschniev/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fdi/iwan-reschniev/")  
Lobby Card JNL [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/lobby-card/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/lobby-card/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/lobby-card/")  
There are quite a few that that match the \_R\_ but not the \_S\_ and vice versa. Run through the stovepipe tag at Myfonts [http://www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Agaspipe/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319231548/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Agaspipe/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Agaspipe/fonts/") and you will see what I mean.  
All are wider than your letters, although Iwan Reschnie is closer in width than the others.  
Don
Wow, as usual very impressive, Fivos! That's almost matching everything... Didn't know this Matthan Sans.

In my opinion of all the fonts mentioned so far, the closest matches might be Deerfield and Matthan Sans. It has \_A\_ with apex top, \_R\_ with vertical leg, \_S\_ with horizontal center stroke, and the a similar 7. Matthan Sans is little more rounded than your image, but you seem to like the rounded aspect.  
Don
Wonderful suggestions! Thank you so much for your suggestions. These will certainly do the trick!
